title: How to Build a Simple Nest Box for Garden Birds

steps.headline: Use pine or cedar 4, 6 or 8 inches (10, 15, 20 cm) wide.
steps.description: For a small box cut a 4" (10cm )  wide board 6" (15cm) long for the bottom.

steps.headline: Cut four 6" (15cm) wide boards 12 " (30cm) long for the sides.
Attach sides to bottom and each other with exterior screws.
steps.description: To one of the side boards, attach roof flashing or other metal to prevent squirrels or woodpeckers from enlarging the hole you are about to drill. Drill a 1.5" (3.8cm) hole in flashing and wood.

steps.headline: After connecting the sides, you should have square box.
Cut a backboard and roofing that would fit the box you made.
Drill a hole on one side of the nest.
steps.description: Do not attach the base to the backboard. Owls and woodpeckers leave a mess. You can clean the base by removing the screws.

steps.headline: Attach a 4" (10cm) board (treated wood) 18-22 inches (45 - 50cm) long to the back.
steps.description: Attach a roof to the top with hinges. Roof should extend 1-2" (2.5 - 5cm). Place box 9 feet (2.7 metres) or higher.

steps.headline: Place the nest on your garden.
